whirl.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to turn or spin around very quickly, or to make someone or something do this
whirl.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: We watched the seagulls whirling and shrieking over the harbour.
She whirled around and her look shook him.
He whirled her round in his arms.
whirl.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if your head is whirling, or if thoughts are whirling in your head, your mind is full of thoughts and ideas, and you feel very confused or excited
whirl.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: His head was whirling with excitement.
The implications began to whirl around in her head.
whirl.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a lot of activity of a particular kind
whirl.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: the social whirl of New York publishing
The next two days passed in a whirl of activity.
whirl.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a spinning movement or the shape of something that is spinning
whirl.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: A car rumbled over the bumpy dirt road, leaving behind a whirl of white dust.
